sen.j: 法護寺（ほうごじ）は、京都府舞鶴市に所在する日蓮正宗の寺院。
sen.e: Hogo-ji Temple is a temple of Nichiren Sho Sect, that is located in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Hogo-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Sho Sect, that is located in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Hogo-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Sho Sect, that is located in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は鶴照山（かくしょうさん）。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Kakushosan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Kakushosan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Kakushosan.
The origin and history
The origin and history
The origin and history

sen.j: - 法護院として建立される。
sen.e: This temple was erected as Hogo-in Temple.
This temple was erected as Hogo-in Temple.
This temple was erected as Hogo-in Temple.

sen.j: 開基は日蓮正宗大石寺第67世法主日顕上人。
sen.e: Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) was Nikken Shonin, the 67th head priest of Nichirenshoshu Taiseki-ji Temple.
Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) was Nikken Shonin, the 67th head priest of Nichirenshoshu Taiseki-ji Temple.
Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding) was Nikken Shonin, the 67th head priest of Nichirenshoshu Taiseki-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1961年（昭和36年）5月9日に舞鶴市には無数山実度寺が建立されたが、当時の住職が正信会側についたため建立された。
sen.e: Musuzan Jitsudo-ji Temple was erected in Maizuru City on May 9, 1961, because a chief priest at that time sided with Shoshinkai (correct faith association).
Musuzan Jitsudo-ji Temple was erected in Maizuru City on May 9, 1961, because the chief priest at the time sided with Shoshinkai (correct faith association).
Musuzan Jitsudo-ji Temple was erected in Maizuru City on May 9, 1961, because the chief priest at the time sided with Shoshinkai (correct faith association).

sen.j: 実度寺の当時の住職が第67世法主日顕上人の法主としての地位を否定したため,日蓮正宗の宗制宗規に違背したことにより破門された。
sen.e: Since a chief priest in Jitsudo-ji Temple at that time denied the position of Nikken Shonin, the 67th head priest of Nichirenshoshu Taiseki-ji Temple as a head priest, he was excommunicated for disobeying religious institute and regulations of Nichiren Sho Sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since the chief priest in Jitsudo-ji Temple at the time denied the position of Nikken Shonin, the 67th head priest of Nichirenshoshu Taiseki-ji Temple as a head priest, he was excommunicated for disobeying the religious institute and regulations of the Nichiren Sho Sect.

Since the chief priest in Jitsudo-ji Temple at the time denied the position of Nikken Shonin, the 67th head priest of Nichirenshoshu Taiseki-ji Temple as a head priest, he was excommunicated for disobeying the religious institute and regulations of the Nichiren Sho Sect.

sen.j: が、現在まで実度寺の占有・居住を継続している。
sen.e: Despite this, he has continued to occupy and reside in Jitsudo-ji Temple until now.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Despite this, he has continued to occupy and reside in Jitsudo-ji Temple until now.
Despite this, he has continued to occupy and reside in Jitsudo-ji Temple until now.

sen.j: 現在地に移転,山号寺号が公称され, 鶴照山法護寺となる。
sen.e: After temple was relocated to the present place, its sango-jigo(mountain name-temple name) was changed to Kakushosan Hogo-ji Temple.
After the temple was relocated to its present place, its sango-jigo (mountain name-temple name) was changed to Kakushosan Hogo-ji Temple.
After the temple was relocated to its present place, its sango-jigo (mountain name-temple name) was changed to Kakushosan Hogo-ji Temple.
